core.title: Paw Cafe
core.desc: Find coffee shops all across Taiwan

info.item3: UI Design, UX Research, Design System, Front-end Develop

brief.item1:
This is a personal project designed as a practice platform for integrating databases and implementing various interactive features. The goal of this project is to simulate key functionalities in real product development, including shopping carts, product favorites, login and registration systems, allowing me to gain a comprehensive understanding of the connection between design and backend technologies.

During the project, I focused not only on designing the visual interface and user flow but also learned how to use databases for data management, enabling the storage and retrieval of user and product information.
brief.item2-1: Supports user account creation, login authentication, and data storage while ensuring system security and user data privacy.
brief.item3-1: I used Firebase as the database, achieving seamless integration between the backend database and the frontend interface to support dynamic updates and synchronization of user information, product lists, and more.
brief.item4-1: Provides a complete shopping experience, including adding products to the cart, adjusting quantities, and removing items, ensuring a smooth and intuitive user experience.
brief.item5-1: Designed a favorites list that allows users to mark their preferred products for easy viewing and management at any time.

briefCard.item1: Focusing on practicing front-end functionality implementation, the project involves connecting to a database and simulating common e-commerce platform requirements such as shopping cart, product favorites, and login/registration functions. Through project development, it enhances front-end technical skills and strengthens the integration of UI design and functionality.
briefCard.item2: In this project, I served as both a UI/UX designer and a front-end engineer. I completed the integration of café data across Taiwan, allowing users to search for cafés nationwide, and developed the membership system and shopping cart features.
briefCard.item3: When practicing front-end functionality, I practiced integrating APIs for the first time. I spent more time understanding it. Integrating APIs made data interaction more complex, and I also had to ensure that the product data in the shopping cart could be updated in real time and correctly reflected on the front end.
briefCard.item4: After the project was completed, I successfully developed a functional front-end application, which also enhanced my understanding of front-end technologies, adding technical value to future product development.

background.item1: I usually enjoy going to cafes on my days off, but finding a cafe that meets my needs often takes a lot of time. I have to open Google Maps and check each one, or look at reviews to find out if the cafe has outlets, Wi-Fi, or if there are enough seats. Based on this need, I decided to make it the goal of my project. I integrated a third-party API database to create a website focused on cafe information across Taiwan. To further practice my frontend skills, I also added e-commerce and membership system features.

goal.item1: Provide coffee shop information across Taiwan

problem.item1: Not familiar with connecting to the database system
problem.item2: Some data in the database is inconsistent or missing

info.item2: Likes to stay in coffee shops on weekends
info.item3: Works on a computer for long hours in coffee shops

difficult.item1: Spends a lot of time searching for the right coffee shop

process.item1-1: I utilized an open-source café data API, connected the API to the frontend, and set up a list to display data such as name, address, and ratings.
process.item1-2: The database did not provide photos of coffee shops. To meet the visual presentation requirements, I integrated the Unspalsh API to generate images randomly.
process.item2-1: I used Firebase to create account management and a product database.

flow.item1:
Shopping Cart Checkout Process:
After adding items to the shopping cart, you can adjust the quantity in the cart component. Clicking checkout will direct you to the checkout page to fill in the order information. Once the checkout is submitted, the order is completed.

principle.item1-1: I displayed the café's information on the homepage, allowing users to intuitively view the details upon entering the website.
principle.item2-1: I designed a consistent style for various cards, making the page look neat and clean while ensuring uniformity when integrating with the database.
principle.item3-1: Detailed information is tucked into a side drawer component, revealed only when clicked, to keep the layout from becoming cluttered.
principle.item4-1: The website uses a warm and comfortable color palette (such as beige and dark gray) to convey a relaxing café ambiance.

handoff.item1: In Figma, I demonstrated dark mode styles using the Variable feature, allowing toggling through a control panel to view the results of different color presentations. Additionally, I showcased various breakpoints for responsive web design (RWD) and how the designs appear on different devices to ensure a great user experience across all screen sizes.

feedback.item1-1: In this project, I completed the integration of the frontend, backend, and database, focusing on data retrieval and presentation. During the design phase, I made multiple adjustments to the user interface based on system requirements to ensure a balance between user experience and functionality.
feedback.item2-1: I practiced integrating third-party database APIs, learning how to efficiently retrieve data and display it on the frontend interface. Additionally, I optimized API request handling to enhance system performance.
feedback.item3-1: Using Firebase, I built a product database and a member management system with security restrictions for member passwords. For data operations, any updates made on the frontend (e.g., product inventory or member information) were synchronized in real-time with the database to ensure data consistency.
feedback.item4-1: While developing the registration feature, I designed a process where new members' data is immediately created in the database upon registration. Moreover, I ensured that updates to user information (such as passwords) were synchronized with the database, enhancing system integrity.
feedback.item5-1: The shopping cart functionality was one of the most challenging parts of this project. I implemented features for adjusting quantities and removing items from the cart, utilizing Vue Store for state management to maintain data consistency and ensure a smooth shopping cart and order processing experience.
